rsbNotes.title: Pr 5
rsbNotes.text: 5:1–23 This passage is best taken as a single unit. While vv. 15–23 are conceivably a distinct composition, the theme is a logical development of what goes before. Wisdom urges us to avoid the life-destroying adulteress and to find sexual and emotional satisfaction in faithfulness to the marriage bond.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 5:21–23
rsbNotes.text: 5:21–23 Up to this point, the warnings against adultery have not been referred to God’s law. Similar warnings can be found in other wisdom traditions. Now the writer explains that the natural consequences of folly, and especially sexual folly, are punishments ordained by God.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 5:23
rsbNotes.text: 5:23 dies. See notes on v. 5 and 2:18.
